intro: Hicksbeachia diversifolia, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of New Zealand. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red flowers that bloom throughout the summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, providing a textured appearance. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure. Hicksbeachia diversifolia is an important component of coastal ecosystems, supporting local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
